content.description: Climb the left side of the arete. A crux comes right before a large ledge at roughly 2/3 height. Follow the final bolts up to the anchors, again staying on the left side of the arete to a stance right of the anchors. Reach out left to clip the anchor bolts.
content.location:
This route is on the panel to the left, around the arete from

Pullin' Down in the Fields of Cotton

, on the far right end of the Bank area.

content.description:
This route is located on the far end of The Bank. This is the last route on the southwest face. It is located between "

Welcome to Shelf Road

, 5.10d," and "New World Odor, 5.11b/c". Start at a belay bolt, and follow a crack about 2-3 feet left of the arete. Rest on a ledge and try and figure out the crux moves to the anchor. There are nice views of Cactus Cliff from here. There are fun jams and good exposure on this route.

Per

Glenn Schuler

: excellent & airy face climbing up the left side of an arete takes you to an exposed stance below the crux bulge. Get a good rest & crank past the sharp finishing holds to the anchor.

Eds. This is a combination of submissions merged onto the 1st submission page to avoid confusion and duplication.
content.protection: A handful of draws and a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
Per

Glenn Schuler

: this route starts off an exposed ledge that is situated right at the southern-most point of the Vault, where the cliff band makes a 90 degree bend up canyon (west). There is a belay bolt on the ledge.

To find the routes in this sector, look for a faint trail that branches off the main trail coming from the Bank a few hundred feet before it meets the road.

climbs.name: Pullin' Down in the Fields of Cotton

content.description:
This is a fun lead for the new 10 leader.

Stem on the opposite face at the bottom. The crux is between the first and second bolts if you stay on the face - small nub and huecos as you position right and then left. Then climb left of the bolts, and use the face pockets and the first left seam.
content.protection: (5?) bolts and drop-ins at the anchor.
content.location:
This is beyond the 2150 Wall opposite of

Peking

.

content.description: This route is located about one to two hundred yards past the 2150 wall.  This route is located on a sunny wall across from a 5.10c on a right facing wall.  I believe this is the fourth bolted route beyond the 2150 wall.  A sunny warm up on those winter days.
